message.content:
{"id": "269522", 
"title": "Bug 269522 - Cross reference view and markers mix up joinpoints assigned to advice", 
"description": "The cross reference view and markers mix up joinpoints assigned to advice.", 
"OB": "1. Open the code file.
2. Open the cross reference view.
3. Select line 22 and observe that there are 5 joinpoints (should only be 3).
4. Select line 68 and observe that there are zero joinpoints (should be 2 here).
5. Right click the marker at line 68 and choose 'advises'. Observe that you see all 5 joinpoints.", 
"EB": "1. Open the code file.
2. Open the cross reference view.
3. Select line 22 and observe that there are 5 joinpoints (should only be 3).
4. Select line 68 and observe that there are zero joinpoints (should be 2 here).
5. Right click the marker at line 68 and choose 'advises'. Observe that you see all 5 joinpoints.", 
"SR": "The cross reference view and marker functionality should correctly display joinpoints assigned to advice. Fix the issue causing incorrect counts of joinpoints in both the cross reference view and markers."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
